Sheps Center for Health Services Research seeks to improve the health of individuals, families, and populations by understanding the problems, issues, and alternatives in the design and delivery of health care services. This is accomplished through an interdisciplinary program of research, consultation, technical assistance, and training that focuses on timely and policy-relevant questions concerning the accessibility, adequacy, organization, cost, and effectiveness of health care services, and the dissemination of this information to policymakers and the general public. Position Summary The Cecil G. Sheps Center for Health Services Research at The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is recruiting a Research Investigator to work on research projects related to health care payment and delivery reform, directed by Valerie Lewis, PhD. A Research Investigator with a strong methodologic background for multiple research studies is needed for projects examining the impact of health care delivery reforms, including population-based payment models as well as models for integrating care for social and medical needs. This position is needed to conduct and assist in the design, analysis and interpretation of diverse quantitative data as well as in-depth, qualitative data with social service and medical providers. This person will work with research team to help develop and operationalize research questions, recommend and apply analytic approaches and assist with interpretation. The Research Investigator will have the independence to lead related research projects and provide data management and programming support for health policy and delivery research including (a) writing proposals, (b) planning and conducting analyses, © writing manuscripts and findings briefs, (d) supervising and mentoring students, (e) helping with data needs such as qualitative data collection with health care and social service providers. Minimum Education and Experience Requirements Relevant post-Baccalaureate degree required (or foreign degree equivalent); for candidates demonstrating comparable independent research productivity, will accept a relevant Bachelor’s degree (or foreign degree equivalent) and 3 or more years of relevant experience in substitution. May require terminal degree and licensure. Required Qualifications, Competencies, and Experience Doctorate degree in relevant field (e.g., public policy, health services research, health policy and management, anthropology, sociology, economics, epidemiology, etc.) Must be able to work with substantial independence and expertise in original scholarship, research design, research engineering, implementation of research procedures, data analysis and interpretation of results. Demonstrated knowledge of and experience in methods appropriate for analysis of health policy, including qualitative and quantitative methods Substantial experience using qualitative and/or quantitative research methods. Demonstrated experience in academic analysis and writing, public speaking and presentation, and quantitative and qualitative research methodologies. Experience with policy analysis and policy research Proactive team orientation with communication and collaborative interpersonal skills. Minimum three years of experience with health policy research.
